intro: Drypetes ramiflora, commonly known as the ramiflorous drypetes, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish-brown bark and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that split open to release seeds. It is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid, tropical climates.
